# regexp/control-character-escape

ðŸ’¼ This rule is enabled in the following configs: ðŸŸ¢ `flat/recommended`, ðŸ”µ `recommended`.

ðŸ”§ This rule is automatically fixable by the [`--fix` CLI option](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/user-guide/command-line-interface#--fix).

<!-- end auto-generated rule header -->

> enforce consistent escaping of control characters

## :book: Rule Details

This rule reports control characters that were not escaped using a control escape (`\0`, `\t`, `\n`, `\v`, `\f`, `\r`).

<eslint-code-block fix>

<!-- markdownlint-disable no-hard-tabs -->

```js
/* eslint regexp/control-character-escape: "error" */

/* âœ“ GOOD */
var foo = /[\n\r]/;
var foo = /\t/;
var foo = RegExp("\t+\n");

/* âœ— BAD */
var foo = /	/;
var foo = /\u0009/;
var foo = /\u{a}/u;
var foo = RegExp("\\u000a");
```

<!-- markdownlint-enable no-hard-tabs -->

</eslint-code-block>

## :wrench: Options

Nothing.

## :rocket: Version

This rule was introduced in eslint-plugin-regexp v0.9.0
